content: Fixed a lot of stuff. I have no idea how it was approved
And there are no IDE tests with a "0" in them as well...
another puzzle approved without thinking. the length requirement should be stated in the statement, not figured out from the tests...

Just the "INVALID LENGTH" test isn't useful.
For the "CONTENT ALBHABET" test, meh, but why not.

Why are you focus on the length of the number ?
It is a true question.

1) I think that ":-" in the list isn't adquate, because I, for example, thought that 1 was "- .----"

2) If it is a game of speed and length code, why don't you give the list in a formatted way? If the user copy and paste, he is going to lose time and increase it's code, so it's not that benefical.

3) I agree with the upgrade in statements.

But here is my upvote. :)
As others said the statements need to be adjusted. And it could be really good with some "upgrades"

In the subject, you should remove the "-", it could be interpretted as a part of the morse code by some people.

Is it really necessary to put a limit of length ? And alphabet letter are an error case interessant. But this clash is complex enough without these two things and they are not specified in the subject (they are implicit).

The puzzle could be really good with some improvements.
"except numbers are is allowed" -> "except numbers are allowed"

The "Constraints" section is supposed to emphasize some (already verified) restrictions on the inputs that are useful to solve the problem. Your current constraints section should be moved to the main statement (moreover this "length 10" condition is completely hidden and is only tested by one validator).

Already accepted, yet, even though the "Constraints" section has been changed to:
"no other characters except numbers are allowed"
it is still improper for the exact same reasons (cases 2 contain a-z chars)...
Moreover, the "INVALID LENGTH" test has no reason to be anymore (the "length 10" condition has completely disappeared).
